document.id: Pueblo de San Ildefonso Council Res. No. SI-R21-025
document.heading: PUEBLO DE SAN ILDEFONSO COUNCIL RESOLUTION NO. SI-R21-025
Authorizing Loan to San Ildefonso Services, LLC for C-Store Improvements
document.preamble: At a duly called meeting of the Council of San Ildefonso Pueblo on the 12th day of November, 2021, the following law was adopted:

recital.text: the Council established and chartered San Ildefonso Services, LLC ("SIS, LLC") under tribal law as a single member limited liability company wholly owned by the Pueblo; and,

in accordance with the Fifth Amended Articles of Organization of SIS LLC ("Articles of Organization"), the duly-appointed members of the five (5) person Member's Representative group (the "Member's Representatives") together exercise all rights of the Pueblo in its role as the single member of SIS LLC; and,

SIS LLC is a Manager-Managed limited liability company, and Peter Fant currently serves as the appointed Manager and the Manager possesses the exclusive authority to manage the business affairs of SIS LLC; and,
SIS LLC operates the Totavi and White Rock convenience stores ("C-Stores"); and
both C-Stores are in serious need of equipment upgrades and capital improvements necessary for continued operation and improved sales; and
the Member's Representatives of SIS LLC determined it was in the best interest of SIS LLC to seek funding for the necessary improvements at the C-stores; and,
SIS LLC seeks a loan from the Pueblo which terms are detailed in a proposed Loan Agreement and SIS LLC intends to utilize tribal tax subsidy funding to repay the loan; and,

the Council has reviewed the general terms of the proposed Loan Agreement and believes it is in the best interest of the Pueblo to authorize the Governor to negotiate and enter into a final Loan Agreement with SIS LLC for funding for the C-Store improvements; and,
the Loan Agreement is not intended to be a capital contribution by the Member's Representatives.

para.text: Authorizes the Governor to negotiate and execute a Loan Agreement with SIS LLC for necessary C-Store improvements.
Authorizes the Term of the Loan Agreement for a five-year period beginning June 1, 2021 and ending on May 31, 2026 to match the term of the tribal tax subsidy.
Authorizes up to $450,000 of Pueblo funds for the loan to be taken from available federal grant funds or other available funds.
Authorizes and directs the Governor, or his designee to take such actions as deemed necessary to carry out the intent of this Act

procedural-data.text: The foregoing resolution was duly voted upon by the Council on November 12, 2021, at a meeting with a vote of 7 in favor, 0 opposed, 0 abstaining and 3 absent (Governor presiding and not voting) pursuant to the authority vested in the Council by the Agreement of the Pueblo de San Ildefonso.

section.heading: Short Title
section.text: This enactment shall be known as the "ACT AUTHORIZING LOAN TO SAN ILDEFONSO SERVICES, LLC FOR C-STORE IMPROVEMENTS ("Act")."

section.heading: Purpose
section.text: The Purpose of this Act is to authorize a Loan Agreement between the Pueblo and SIS LLC for necessary equipment upgrades and capital improvements at the Totavi and White Rock convenience stores ("C-Stores").

section.heading: Findings
section.text: The Council hereby finds and declares that:

para.text: San Ildefonso Services, LLC ("SIS, LLC") was established and chartered by the Pueblo under tribal law as a single member limited liability company wholly owned by the Pueblo; and

In accordance with the Fifth Amended Articles of Organization of SIS, LLC ("Articles of Organization"), the duly-appointed members of the five (5) person Member's Representative group (the "Member's Representatives") together exercise all rights of the Pueblo in its role as the single member of SIS, LLC"); and

SIS LLC is a Manager-Managed limited liability company, and Peter Fant currently serves as the appointed Manager and the Manager possesses the exclusive authority to manage the business affairs of SIS LLC; and
SIS LLC operates the Totavi and White Rock convenience stores ("C-Stores"); and
Both C-Stores are in serious need of equipment upgrades and capital improvements necessary for continued operation and improved sales; and
The Member's Representatives of SIS LLC determined it was in the best interest of SIS LLC to seek funding for the necessary improvements at the C-stores; and
SIS LLC seeks a loan from the Pueblo which terms are detailed in a proposed Loan Agreement and SIS LLC intends to utilize Pueblo tax subsidy funding to repay the loan; and

The Council has reviewed the general terms of the proposed Loan Agreement and believes it is in the best interest of the Pueblo to authorize the Governor to negotiate and enter into a final Loan Agreement with SIS LLC for funding for the C-Store improvements; and
The Loan Agreement is not intended to be a capital contribution by the Member's Representatives.
The Council hereby authorizes the Governor to negotiate and execute a Loan Agreement with SIS LLC for necessary improvements at the C-Stores.
The Term of the Loan Agreement shall be for a five-year period beginning June 1, 2021 and ending on May 31, 2026 to match the term of the tribal tax subsidy.
The Council hereby authorizes up to $450,000 of Pueblo funds for the Loan to be taken from available federal grant funds or other available funds.
The Governor, or his designee, is authorized to take such actions as deemed necessary to carry out the intent this Act
